title: Depeche Mode - Live In Hamburg
description:
Depeche Mode - The World We Live In and Live In Hamburg


01 Something To Do		04:27
02 Two Minute Warning	04:34
03 If You Want		05:10
04 People are People	04:13
05 Leave In Silence	04:52
06 New Life		04:12
07 Shame			04:13
08 Somebody		04:55
09 Lie To Me		05:26
10 Blashphemous Rumours	05:23
11 Told You So		04:44
12 Master and Servant	05:12
13 Photographic		04:22
14 Everything Counts	05:46
15 See You		04:43
16 Shout			03:39
17 Just Can't Get Enough	05:28


Running Time:	82 min
Video:		4:3 PAL
Audio:		192kbps AC3 Stereo [256kbps AAC, audio files]


Spent a lot of hours making this due to lots of dropped frames. So I needed to start over. The tape itself is ok, but I guess it was a bit loose in certain places. So I ended up capturing in parts. You won't notice the transitions, except for the opening of Somebody, other than that it's as good as I could hope for. The audio at the end of Blasphemous Rumours is abit out of sync but it's only for about 10-15 seconds. Certain songs I had to channel through another vhs player as I just kept dropping frames, this includes about 4 songs, but the quality is about as good(or bad) as the rest of the video. Hopefully this will be released on dvd or even blu-ray in the future, but this is the best I can conjure atm. If I'd own the japaneese Laser Disc the result would have been better, but cba to buy an old LD player and an overpriced copy of the video from ebay.

I ripped the audio of this in m4a [aac], so it's playable on the ipod. For those who can't play this back on their mp3 player I guess foobar2000 let's you convert it to mp3 or another playable format.
